channel.title: Why do I owe JCoins?
channel.description: Apparently I have -180 JCoins... I was just online 5 minutes ago. Now when I go to log in it tells me 'Your account has negative membership credit. Please log into the billing system to add credit to your account.' The options are 'Add Credit' and 'Back'. 200 JCoins cost $20.00.... I've been paying my membership properly, I actually just bought another month of members yesterday. I haven't botted at all. Why do I owe these JCoins?

item.title: Why do I owe JCoins?
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“ciaran6889, post:21, topic:442832”]Negative JCoins are added to an account when the person who has paid for your membership has questioned a payment with one of jagex’s payment companies (e.g. Global Collect, Boku, PayPal etc.) This is called a disputed payment and the cost of membership has been returned to the bill payer.

basically ther money has gone back to you so the membership needs to get repaid[/quote]

Wow, Jagex gets chargebacks?

Read full topic

item.title: Why do I owe JCoins?
item.dc:creator: @ciaran6889 ciaran6889
item.description:
@ciaran6889 wrote:

Negative JCoins are added to an account when the person who has paid for your membership has questioned a payment with one of jagex’s payment companies (e.g. Global Collect, Boku, PayPal etc.) This is called a disputed payment and the cost of membership has been returned to the bill payer.

basically ther money has gone back to you so the membership needs to get repaid

Read full topic

item.title: Why do I owe JCoins?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:19, topic:442832”][quote author=chains424 link=topic=545517.msg4000976#msg4000976 date=1337988735]
I goggled the problem and came up with this answer from another person.

[b]It’s a common problem with accounts that have been stolen and black-marketed, usually the thief obtains membership credit by illegal means such as credit card fraud, or illegitimate PIN numbers.

Jagex then sees this and bans or locks your account, forcing you to purchase however many months of illegitimate membership the thief had purchased. So if your account was a member for 2 months while the thief was using it, you would have to purchase 2 months of members to reverse the negative credit, thus unlocking your account. [/b]
[/quote]

Couldn’t they just fake the payment the same way they’ve been faking it?[/quote]
pretty sure they limit payment methods with jcoins such as credit card under registered name only or bank transfer

Read full topic

item.title: Why do I owe JCoins?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“chains424, post:18, topic:442832”]I goggled the problem and came up with this answer from another person.

[b]It’s a common problem with accounts that have been stolen and black-marketed, usually the thief obtains membership credit by illegal means such as credit card fraud, or illegitimate PIN numbers.

Jagex then sees this and bans or locks your account, forcing you to purchase however many months of illegitimate membership the thief had purchased. So if your account was a member for 2 months while the thief was using it, you would have to purchase 2 months of members to reverse the negative credit, thus unlocking your account. [/b][/quote]

Couldn’t they just fake the payment the same way they’ve been faking it?

Read full topic

item.title: Why do I owe JCoins?
item.dc:creator: @chains424 chains424
item.description:
@chains424 wrote:

I goggled the problem and came up with this answer from another person.

[b]It’s a common problem with accounts that have been stolen and black-marketed, usually the thief obtains membership credit by illegal means such as credit card fraud, or illegitimate PIN numbers.

Jagex then sees this and bans or locks your account, forcing you to purchase however many months of illegitimate membership the thief had purchased. So if your account was a member for 2 months while the thief was using it, you would have to purchase 2 months of members to reverse the negative credit, thus unlocking your account. [/b]

Read full topic

It means a dispute has occurred. Go to your inbox for RS and there should be a message

TBH, I know people have had negative membership days before just google it.

that is perhaps the least useful comment i’ve ever seen

[/quote]

lmgtfy.com

LMGTFY

LMGTFY

Basically it means you had a dispute with your payment.[/quote]

i know someone who uses lmgtfy, just google it

item.title: Why do I owe JCoins?
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:10, topic:442832”]what

the fuck

is

a JCoin

It better NOT be what I think it is[/quote]

JCoins is Jagex’s currency. They probably use JCoins because than it’s a common currency between all countries. (Rather than some paying dollars, euros, rupees etc). Not sure why that would make a difference though.

Read full topic
